scenes.background: You are on annual leave, enjoying some well-deserved time off to recharge. However, during your time away, a colleague messages you privately, saying thereâ€™s an urgent task that needs immediate attention. The request creates a dilemma as you try to balance respecting your time off while feeling the pressure to help with the urgent task.
scenes.description: 'Hey, I know you're on leave, but we have this urgent task that needs to be done right away. Can you help us out?'

options.text: Sure, I can take a quick look at it now.
options.analysis: You chose to assist despite being on leave, showing good emotional control and motivation. However, this may impact your ability to recharge effectively.

options.text: I'm really sorry, but I need this time to recharge. Could someone else handle it?
options.analysis: You prioritized your own well-being, showing good emotional perception and empathy. However, interpersonal balance could be better.

options.text: I can help you for a short time, but I'll need to hand it off to someone else after that.
options.analysis: You chose a middle ground, showing good social skills and emotional balance. However, motivation and self-regulation could be higher.

new_scenarios.background: [Monica] and [Bob] are discussing the urgent task in the office. You join the conversation via a video call.
new_scenarios.description: 'I understand you need to recharge, but we really need your expertise on this. Can't you just spare an hour?'

options.text: I'll see what I can do, but I can't promise anything right now.
options.analysis: You acknowledge the urgency but maintain your boundaries, showing good emotional perception and self-regulation.

options.text: Alright, I'll help out for an hour, but then I really need to disconnect.
options.analysis: You compromise by offering limited help, showing empathy and motivation, but potentially compromising your own well-being.

options.text: I understand the urgency, but I can't help right now. Please find someone else.
options.analysis: You prioritize your need for rest, showing strong self-regulation, but empathy and motivation are lower.

new_scenarios.background: [Bob], visibly frustrated, looks at you on the video call.
new_scenarios.description: 'This is not just any task, it's crucial for our client. Your absence is really impacting us. What do you suggest we do?'

options.text: I understand the importance, but I suggest delegating it to someone else who is available.
options.analysis: You suggest a practical solution while maintaining your need for rest, showing good self-regulation but lower empathy and motivation.

options.text: I can guide someone through it over a call if that helps.
options.analysis: You offer a compromise by suggesting remote guidance, showing good emotional perception and empathy.

options.text: I really can't take this on right now. Can we discuss a contingency plan for such situations in the future?
options.analysis: You decline to help but suggest discussing future plans, showing good emotional perception and self-regulation.

new_scenarios.background: [Monica] nods understandingly while [Bob] seems a bit resigned. The conversation shifts to planning for future urgent tasks.
new_scenarios.description: 'How about we create a rota system for handling urgent tasks when someone is on leave?'

options.text: That sounds like a good idea. Let's work on a rota system.
options.analysis: You agree to the rota system, showing good emotional perception and social skills but less self-regulation.

options.text: I think it's worth considering, but we need to ensure it's fair and doesn't overburden anyone.
options.analysis: You cautiously agree, showing empathy and social skill, but motivation could be higher.

options.text: I'm not sure if a rota system is the best solution. We might need a more flexible approach.
options.analysis: You suggest a different approach, showing good self-regulation but lower empathy.
